transport: Singapore’s MRT system is the fastest and most affordable way to travel between key attractions. Taxis and ride-hailing services like Grab are widely available for door-to-door convenience.
attractions: Marina Bay Sands and Gardens by the Bay
Singapore Botanic Gardens (UNESCO World Heritage Site)
tips: Avoid rush hours between 7–9 a.m. and 6–8 p.m. when taking public transport.
Singapore is very clean and strict about littering—dispose of waste properly.

transport: Seoul’s subway network covers the entire metropolitan area with English signage. Taxis are plentiful and reasonably priced for short trips.
attractions: N Seoul Tower on Namsan Mountain
tips: Purchase a T-Money card for convenient transfers on buses and subways.
Public transport shuts down around midnight—plan evening travel ahead.

transport: Tokyo’s JR trains and subway lines are efficient and punctual. Suica and Pasmo prepaid cards can be used for trains, buses, and even convenience stores.
tips: Avoid using your phone for calls inside trains—it’s considered impolite.
Carry some cash; many small restaurants and shops remain cash-only.

transport: The BTS Skytrain and MRT subway are the most reliable ways to move through central Bangkok. River ferries offer scenic alternatives to avoid traffic congestion.
attractions: The Grand Palace and Wat Phra Kaew
tips: Dress modestly when visiting temples—shoulders and knees should be covered.
Use official metered taxis or Grab to avoid overcharging.

transport: Paris’s Metro and RER trains connect all major districts and attractions. Walking and cycling are also pleasant options, especially in central arrondissements.
attractions: Notre-Dame Cathedral and the Latin Quarter
tips: Buy a carnet (bundle) of Metro tickets to save money on multiple rides.
Pickpocketing can occur in tourist areas—keep bags closed and valuables secure.

transport: While Los Angeles has buses and metro lines, most visitors rent a car for flexibility. Rideshare services like Uber and Lyft are widely available across the city.
tips: Traffic is heaviest between 7–10 a.m. and 4–7 p.m.; plan around rush hours.
Parking fees vary widely—check signage carefully before leaving your car.
